string.text: File

A weapon cleaning file crafted from high-carbon steel, offering precision and durability for maintaining the parts of various firearms. It has fine and uniform teeth to effectively remove rust, burrs, and fouling from metal surfaces. An ergonomic handle provides a comfortable grip for precise control in delicate repair tasks. Files of different sizes are commonly used in repair workshops and camps for maintaining weapon parts, an essential task for preventing malfunctions and extending the lifespan of carried weaponry.

Multitool

A multi-tool made from high quality stainless steel, designed for a wide number of crafting and repair tasks. Includes a line-up of precision screwdrivers, pliers, wire cutters, and a small blade, all housed in a compact, foldable design. Enables disassembly and maintenance of electronic devices, weapons, and other equipment. The tool's versatility and durability make it indispensable for field repairs and adjustments and is also found in many workshops. Each implement locks securely in place, ensuring safe and reliable use during intricate tasks. Though it can be used for a multitude of tasks, its smaller components may require periodic tightening and lubrication to maintain optimal performance and bigger tools and repair kits may be more suited.

Ramrod

A ramrod constructed from lightweight aluminum, essential for cleaning and restoring firearm parts. It features a threaded end for attaching various brushes and jags, allowing thorough removal of debris and fouling from barrels and chambers. The ramrod's sectional design enables easy storage and transport, making it a practical tool for field maintenance. Its robust construction ensures longevity, though repeated use may lead to minor bending that should be inspected for periodically. A widely used item by technical military personnel, stalkers, and hunters for firearms maintenance and repair tasks.

Universal Weapon Part Cleaning Kit

A universal weapon part cleaning kit, designed to maintain firearms of all common calibers and keep them in optimal working condition. The kit includes a small portion of high-efficiency lubricant and cleaning solvent for thorough removal of residue and other contaminants often accumulating in extensively used equipment. Additionally, it contains a number of light tools, such as brushes, picks, and cloths to access inner mechanisms and hard-to-reach areas. It comes in a compact case for both use in the field and inside workshops. Regular use of this kit helps prevent malfunctions and extends the lifespan of firearms and may restore a heavily used item to a condition where it can be maintained by less expensive methods. Ensure proper ventilation when using included solvents during cleaning.

Sewing Thread

A roll of nylon sewing thread, commonly chosen for universal outfit repairs for its durability and resilience. This high-tensile thread is resistant to abrasion, moisture, and UV light, ideal for mending protective equipment and clothing in any condition. The smooth texture of the material allows for easy threading and consistent stitches. While exceptionally strong, the thread can sometimes slip through fabric more easily than cotton, necessitating secure knotting. Sewing thread is often included in military-issue repair kits and used by virtually all outfit vendors and mechanics. It is advised to use it in conjunction with high quality spare fabrics for more effective repairs.

Field Armor Repair Kit

A well-equipped military kit for armor repairs in the field. The kit includes patches, adhesive, and specialized tools to mend and reinforce body armor and tactical gear. It contains multiple rolls of Kevlar thread, a material with exceptional strength and resistance to heat and abrasion for reliable stitching, suited for equipment repairs that need to endure extended combat scenarios. The kit's components are organized in a compact, weather-resistant case for rapid, on-the-go repairs. While highly effective, the Kevlar thread can be challenging to cut and requires a specialized cutter and demands some tailoring experience from the user. It provides an effective alternative to repair services offered by various workshops in the Zone.

Glue Tube ("M17")

M17 is a result of a Soviet military-industrial research project intended to devise an extremely potent, single-ingredient adhesive which could be used in any situation regardless of purpose and the materials involved. There is almost no damage that the glue won't be able to repair. Can be used with all materials available in the Zone.

Sharpening Stone Set

An assortment of different grit sharpening stones for everyday maintenance of blades and knives, packed in a durable polyester bag. The set includes coarse, medium, and fine grit stones for a range of sharpening tasks, from initial edge restoration to final honing. Each stone is made from silicon carbide, providing reliable performance for routine sharpening needs. The bag makes the set portable and keeps the stones organized and protected. While effective for most sharpening tasks, the stones may wear down over time and require occasional resurfacing. Not suited for serrated blades.
